column3: Early deletes billed pro‑rata; retrieval fee applies. Use for infrequent but rapid access.
Cheaper single‑AZ resilience; not for mission‑critical data.

column1: Minimum storage duration: Glacier Flexible Retrieval?
column3: Lower cost archival; retrieval in minutes to hours; retrieval fee tiers.

column1: Minimum storage duration: Glacier Deep Archive?
column3: Lowest cost archival; hours retrieval; high early‑delete penalties.
No retrieval fees for Frequent/IA; auto‑tiers across frequent, infrequent, archive tiers.

column2: Transform data on‑the‑fly per request via Lambda
column3: Redact PII, convert formats without changing underlying object.

column2: Broker fine‑grained, auditable access to S3 data
column3: Centralizes entitlements, short‑lived creds; integrates with identities and catalogs.

column2: Logging = access logs in a bucket; CloudTrail = API audit
column3: Use both: logs for access analytics; CloudTrail for security/compliance events.

column2: URL = simple GET/PUT; POST = browser HTML form upload
column3: POST supports policy conditions (size, key prefix, headers) for secure direct uploads.

column2: Use routing rules or object metadata Website‑Redirect‑Location
Encrypts each object with two independent KMS keys
column3: Extra protection; configure via headers or bucket default; higher cost/latency.

column2: EventBridge = broader event bus; legacy = direct SNS/SQS/Lambda
column3: EventBridge scales, supports filtering/routing across services.
Compare performance by region and bucket; enable TA first on the bucket.

column2: Parts: 5 MB–5 GB (except last); up to 10,000 parts
column3: Choose part size so total parts ≤ 10k; record UploadId for resume/abort.

column2: Parallelize range reads for large objects; respect server limits
column3: Use 8–16 MB ranges; cap concurrency to avoid throttling.
Enables policy insights; fix unintended exposure quickly.

column2: DNS alias usable where bucket name is expected
Use multipart, parallelism, keep‑alive, and modern SDKs
column3: Key randomization no longer required; rely on SDK retries/backoff and connection pooling.
